title: Visualizing the Point-Spread Function of the SEM Optics
content: Aberrations are the primary cause of poor resolution in uncorrected scanning electron microscopes (SEM). The first aberration correction in SEM was achieved using multipole correctors [1]. Since then, the field has been focused on correcting optics and improving the initial designs. These aberration correctors are very expensive and not easy to tune. Another approach to aberration correction can be wavefront-sensing based correction [2]. In that regard, probe intensity and phase information become pivotal. Recently, there has been an effort to reconstruct probe intensity [3-6] and probe phase using the reconstructed intensities [7, 8].
